decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly getting powerful creatures into the graveyard and then reanimating them for a powerful combo finish. Using cards like Faithless Looting and Thought Scour to discard creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Emperor of Bones, then using spells like Persist and Unearth to bring them back onto the battlefield. Thoughtseize helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan while Fatal Push and Spell Pierce provide removal and protection. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats early in the game and control the board until victory.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Arboreal Grazer and Explore, while utilizing Amulet of Vigor to untap lands for extra mana. The goal is to assemble the Amulet Titan combo, using Primeval Titan to fetch lands like The Mycosynth Gardens and Urza's Saga to generate a massive amount of mana and overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Scapeshift and Summoner's Pact help to quickly find the necessary pieces to execute the combo. Additionally, cards like Boseiju, Who Endures provide protection for key spells.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay using a combination of efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Consign to Memory, and enchantments like Leyline of the Guildpact to boost the team. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a mix of creature damage and direct spells, while also having some control elements in the form of Stubborn Denial. The mana base is optimized for fast and consistent plays, ensuring the deck can maintain pressure throughout the game.

The deck focuses on assembling a combo involving Broodscale Bloodchief, utilizing cards like Writhing Chrysalis and Malevolent Rumble to generate tokens and pump them up with Blade of the Bloodchief. Glaring Fleshraker and Kozilek's Command provide removal and disruption, while Urza's Saga helps find key pieces. Emrakul, the Promised End serves as a game-ending threat. The deck also includes utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Eldrazi Temple to support the combo. Overall, the key strategy is to create a powerful board presence quickly and overwhelm the opponent with tokens and synergies.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to quickly flood the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By leveraging cards like Mishra's Bauble, Mox Opal, and Thought Monitor, the deck aims to generate card advantage and mana efficiency. With powerful threats like Ornithopter and Pinnacle Emissary backed up by counterspells like Metallic Rebuke, the deck can apply pressure while protecting its own board state. Additionally, the inclusion of Urza's Saga provides further utility and synergy with the artifact strategy. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and disrupt their game plan.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with efficient creatures and burn spells. The deck utilizes a mix of aggressive creatures like Guide of Souls and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, backed up with removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to control the board. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide additional value and card advantage, while cards like Cosmogrand Zenith and Voice of Victory help to close out games quickly. The deck aims to maintain pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan to secure a fast victory.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize cards like Indomitable Creativity and Transmogrify to cheat out powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty onto the battlefield early. The deck also includes cards like Persist and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to help maintain control and generate value. This combo-centric strategy aims to overwhelm opponents with unexpected threats and high-powered creatures, while also incorporating elements of creativity and innovation to keep the opponent on their toes. Utilizing a mix of removal spells and hand disruption, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while executing its own combo.

The main concept of this deck is to use a combination of spells and creatures to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up for a powerful combo finish with Goblin Charbelcher. The deck focuses on controlling the board with counterspells and removal, while also utilizing card draw and tutoring effects to find key combo pieces. By denying the opponent resources and carefully managing the board state, the deck aims to quickly assemble the necessary components for a game-winning Charbelcher activation.

This Esper Control deck focuses on disrupting opponents' strategies with a combination of hand disruption, counterspells, removal spells, and creatures that can bounce or counter spells. The deck aims to control the game through card advantage, removal, and disruption, while also having the ability to close out the game with its own threats like Ketramose, the New Dawn and Psychic Frog. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color strategy and ensure consistency in casting its spells.

This deck focuses on aggressive play with a mix of Boros creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy is to efficiently control the board with cards like Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison while using powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to deal quick damage. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provides additional support and buff to the creatures, allowing for a fast and deadly assault on the opponent. The deck aims to close out games swiftly and decisively before the opponent has a chance to recover.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on utilizing fast and aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With the help of cards like Guide of Souls and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, the deck aims to maintain a consistent board presence and apply pressure. Additionally, cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Goblin Bombardment provide additional reach and removal options. The deck also includes cards like Arena of Glory and Static Prison to control the board and protect its creatures, while cards like Voice of Victory and Thraben Charm provide additional value and utility.

The deck focuses on using Eldrazi creatures and artifact synergies to quickly ramp up mana, generate tokens, and control the board with removal spells. Through utilizing powerful cards like Emrakul, the Promised End and Glaring Fleshraker, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with massive threats and disrupt their game plan. By combining creature-based combos with efficient spells and land acceleration, the deck creates a fast-paced and versatile strategy that can adapt to different matchups and assert dominance through a combination of aggression and disruption.

The deck focuses on using various counterspells and removal spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's plans. It also includes card draw and card advantage engines to maintain resources and find key cards. The win condition is through powerful creature threats like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Thundertrap Trainer, backed up by burn spells and removal to clear the way. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through efficient control and powerful threats.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays and utilizing powerful creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It includes a mix of efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, as well as burn spells like Galvanic Discharge to deal direct damage. The addition of cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide additional versatility and potential for explosive plays. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the aggressive strategy, with necessary lands like Arid Mesa and Sacred Foundry. Overall, the deck aims to maintain pressure and dominance on the battlefield.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures using cards like Faithless Looting and Thought Scour, and then bring them back onto the battlefield using reanimation spells like Unearth and Persist. The deck aims to cheat powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty onto the battlefield earlier than usual, overwhelming the opponent with a strong board presence. In addition, the deck includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the opponent's game plan, while also utilizing Psychic Frog for card advantage and Troll of Khazad-dûm for additional graveyard manipulation.

This Modern Death and Taxes deck focuses on aggressive plays through a combination of disruptive creatures and removal spells. With cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to control the board while deploying threats like Overlord of the Balemurk and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd. The deck also includes some recursion with Ephemerate and Relic of Progenitus to outvalue opponents. By utilizing a mix of disruption and aggressive creatures, this deck aims to pressure opponents while disrupting their game plan, ultimately leading to victory through overwhelming force.
